questions.question_text_en: I ___ a student.
questions.question_text_ja: 私は学生です。

questions.question_text_en: This is my ___.
questions.question_text_ja: これは私の本です。

questions.question_text_en: I ___ soccer every day.
questions.question_text_ja: 私は毎日サッカーをします。

questions.question_text_en: She ___ a cat.
questions.question_text_ja: 彼女は猫を飼っています。

questions.question_text_en: I like ___.
questions.question_text_ja: 私はりんごが好きです。

questions.question_text_en: We ___ to school.
questions.question_text_ja: 私たちは学校へ行きます。

questions.question_text_ja: 私は毎日音楽を聞きます。

questions.question_text_ja: トムとケンは兄弟です。

questions.question_text_en: My mother ___ breakfast every morning.
questions.question_text_ja: 私の母は毎朝朝食を作ります。

questions.question_text_ja: 部屋には2つのいすがあります。

questions.question_text_en: Ken ___ play the piano.
questions.question_text_ja: ケンはピアノをひくことができます。

questions.question_text_ja: 私たちは放課後サッカーをします。

questions.question_text_ja: A: 今何時ですか？ B: ___

questions.question_text_ja: A: 手伝ってくれますか？ B: ___

questions.question_text_en: A: See you tomorrow. B: ___
questions.question_text_ja: A: また明日。 B: ___

questions.passage: My family likes to travel in the summer. We visit many interesting places.

questions.passage: I usually spend weekends with my friends. We like playing games together.

questions.sample_answer: Two girls are playing tennis outside. It looks sunny.

questions.sample_answer: A family is eating dinner together. They look happy.

questions.sample_answer: A teacher is talking to students in a classroom.

questions.image_description: A woman is buying vegetables at a store.
questions.sample_answer: A woman is buying vegetables at a store.

questions.question_text_en: What do you usually do after school?
questions.sample_answer: I usually do my homework and then play games.

questions.question_text_en: Who do you often spend time with on weekends?
questions.sample_answer: I often spend time with my friends.

questions.question_text_en: What is your favorite subject?
questions.sample_answer: My favorite subject is English.

questions.question_text_en: Do you like traveling? Why or why not?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, I do. I like traveling because I can see new places.

questions.question_text_en: What do you usually eat for breakfast?
questions.sample_answer: I usually eat toast and eggs for breakfast.

questions.question_text_en: Do you like reading books?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, I do. I like reading adventure stories.

questions.question_text_en: You received an email from your friend: ‘Can you come to my birthday party this Saturday?’ Write a short reply.
questions.sample_answer: Thank you for your email. Yes, I can come to your birthday party. I’m looking forward to it.

questions.question_text_en: Your friend writes: ‘Let’s study together after school tomorrow.’ Write a reply.
questions.sample_answer: Thanks for your message. Yes, let's study together after school. See you tomorrow!

questions.question_text_en: Your cousin writes: ‘Do you want to go shopping this Sunday?’ Write a short reply.
questions.sample_answer: Thanks for your email. Yes, I want to go shopping with you this Sunday.

questions.question_text_en: Your friend asks: ‘Can you help me with my homework tonight?’ Write a reply.
questions.sample_answer: Thanks for your message. I can help you tonight. Let's study together.

questions.question_text_en: Your friend writes: ‘Do you want to join our soccer club?’ Write a short reply.
questions.sample_answer: Thank you for your message. Yes, I want to join your soccer club. It sounds fun!

questions.question_text_en: Your sister writes: ‘Can you come to the library with me after lunch?’ Write a reply.
questions.sample_answer: Thanks for your message. Yes, I can go to the library with you after lunch.

questions.question_text_en: Your friend writes: ‘Let’s have a picnic next Sunday.’ Write a reply.
questions.sample_answer: Thank you for your email. Yes, let's have a picnic next Sunday. I’m excited!

questions.question_text_en: Your friend writes: ‘Do you want to watch a movie with me tonight?’ Write a reply.
questions.sample_answer: Thanks for your message. Yes, I want to watch a movie with you tonight.

questions.question_text_ja: ケンは将来医者になりたいです。

questions.question_text_ja: 私の父は料理がとても好きです。

questions.question_text_ja: 私の妹は毎晩英語を勉強します。

choices: I’m going to visit my grandparents.
questions.correct_answer: I’m going to visit my grandparents.

questions.question_text_en: A: Do you like studying science? B: ___
A: How do you go to school? B: ___
A: What club are you in? B: ___
Read the passage and answer: What does Ken like to do after school?
questions.passage: Ken usually goes to the library after school. He enjoys reading books, especially mystery stories. Sometimes he studies with his friends there.

questions.question_text_en: What does the writer do with friends?
questions.passage: Every Saturday, I meet my friends at the park. We talk, play games, and sometimes bring snacks to share. It is my favorite time of the week.

questions.question_text_en: Why does the writer want to visit Australia?
questions.passage: I want to visit Australia someday. I want to see many wild animals such as koalas and kangaroos. I also want to learn about Australian culture.

questions.question_text_en: Where does the boy usually practice piano?
questions.passage: Taro practices piano every day. He usually practices in the music room at school, because it is quiet and has a good piano.

questions.question_text_en: What does the girl want to buy?
questions.passage: Yumi saved her money for two months. She wants to buy a new bag for school because her old one is broken.

questions.question_text_en: Why is Sunday special for the writer?
questions.passage: Sunday is special for me. My family eats breakfast together and then we go hiking. I enjoy spending time in nature.

questions.question_text_en: Many people enjoy watching movies at home. They can choose from many genres such as action, comedy, and drama.
questions.passage: Many people enjoy watching movies at home. They can choose from many genres such as action, comedy, and drama.

questions.passage: Studying abroad gives students a chance to learn about different cultures. It also helps them improve their language skills.

questions.question_text_en: Regular exercise is important for a healthy life. Even a short walk every day can make a big difference.
questions.passage: Regular exercise is important for a healthy life. Even a short walk every day can make a big difference.

questions.question_text_en: Many communities have local events to bring people together. These events help people make new friends.
questions.passage: Many communities have local events to bring people together. These events help people make new friends.

questions.question_text_en: Technology has changed the way we communicate. People can now send messages instantly from anywhere in the world.
questions.passage: Technology has changed the way we communicate. People can now send messages instantly from anywhere in the world.

questions.image_description: A student is taking an online class at home using a laptop.
questions.sample_answer: A student is attending an online class at home. They are using a laptop to study.

questions.question_text_en: Do you often communicate with your friends online?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, I often message my friends online because it is fast and easy.

questions.question_text_en: Would you like to study abroad someday?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, I would. I want to learn about different cultures.

questions.question_text_en: What do you do to stay healthy?
questions.sample_answer: I try to exercise regularly and eat balanced meals.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think community events are important?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, they help people meet each other and become closer.

questions.question_text_en: How do you usually communicate with your family?
questions.sample_answer: I usually talk with them at home, but sometimes we text each other.

questions.question_text_en: Do you prefer studying alone or with friends?
questions.sample_answer: I prefer studying with friends because we can help each other.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think students should join club activities?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, I think students should join club activities because they can make friends and learn new skills.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think exercise should be part of daily life?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, because exercising every day keeps people healthy and gives them more energy.

questions.question_text_en: Should students use technology in the classroom?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, because technology helps students find information quickly and makes learning more interesting.

questions.question_text_en: Is traveling a good way to learn about the world?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, traveling is a great way to learn about different cultures and meet new people.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think people should do volunteer work?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, I think people should do volunteer work because it helps the community and teaches people to care for others.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think students should learn foreign languages?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, because learning foreign languages helps students communicate with more people and understand different cultures.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think technology makes life better?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, technology makes life better because it helps us work faster and stay connected with others.

questions.question_text_en: Should people exercise regularly?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, people should exercise regularly because it keeps them healthy and reduces stress.

questions.question_text_en: Ken ___ to Australia last summer.
questions.question_text_ja: ケンは去年の夏にオーストラリアへ行きました。

questions.question_text_en: There are many people ___ want to study abroad.
questions.question_text_ja: 留学したいと思う人はたくさんいます。

questions.question_text_ja: 父は旅行のときに写真を撮るのが好きです。

questions.question_text_en: If you want to stay healthy, you ___ exercise more.
questions.question_text_ja: 健康でいたいなら、もっと運動すべきです。

questions.question_text_en: I will join the event ___ it rains.
questions.question_text_ja: 雨が降らなければ、そのイベントに参加します。

questions.question_text_en: This is the website ___ I used to learn English.
questions.question_text_ja: これは私が英語を勉強するために使ったウェブサイトです。

questions.question_text_en: I have been studying English ___ three years.
questions.question_text_ja: 私は3年間英語を勉強しています。

questions.question_text_en: We need to save energy ___ protect the environment.
questions.question_text_ja: 環境を守るために、私たちはエネルギーを節約する必要があります。

questions.question_text_en: My sister is interested ___ foreign cultures.
questions.question_text_ja: 私の姉は外国の文化に興味があります。

questions.question_text_en: ___ you help me with my homework later?
questions.question_text_ja: 後で宿題を手伝ってくれませんか？

questions.question_text_en: What is one reason the writer likes studying abroad?
questions.passage: I studied in Canada for six months. I met people from many countries and learned to communicate in English every day. It was a great experience.
choices: They met people from many countries
questions.correct_answer: They met people from many countries

questions.question_text_en: Why do people join local events?
questions.passage: Local events help people connect with others in their community. They also give people a chance to learn something new.

questions.question_text_en: What does the writer do to stay healthy?
questions.passage: I try to walk every morning before breakfast. It helps me stay active and clear my mind. I also drink plenty of water every day.

questions.question_text_en: What did the writer buy?
questions.passage: Last week, I bought a new laptop because my old one stopped working. Now I can study and communicate online easily.

questions.question_text_en: Why did the writer start volunteering?
questions.passage: I joined a volunteer group to help clean parks in my city. I wanted to do something good for the community.

questions.question_text_en: Where does the writer usually study?
questions.passage: I usually study at the library because it is quiet and has many useful books. Sometimes I study at home when I need to use my computer.

questions.question_text_en: Many schools are using technology to improve education. Students can access online materials and learn at their own pace.
questions.passage: Many schools are using technology to improve education. Students can access online materials and learn at their own pace.

questions.question_text_en: Environmental problems such as climate change are becoming more serious. People need to find ways to reduce waste and save energy.
questions.passage: Environmental problems such as climate change are becoming more serious. People need to find ways to reduce waste and save energy.

questions.question_text_en: Advances in technology have made communication faster and easier. People can connect instantly with others around the world.
questions.passage: Advances in technology have made communication faster and easier. People can connect instantly with others around the world.

questions.question_text_en: Many young people are interested in volunteering because it allows them to help their communities and gain valuable experience.
questions.passage: Many young people are interested in volunteering because it allows them to help their communities and gain valuable experience.

questions.question_text_en: Some people believe that science will solve many global health problems in the future. However, others think more action is needed today.
questions.passage: Some people believe that science will solve many global health problems in the future. However, others think more action is needed today.

questions.question_text_en: Please describe the picture.
questions.image_description: A woman is giving a presentation in an office. Several people are listening and taking notes.
questions.sample_answer: A woman is giving a presentation, and several people are listening and taking notes.

questions.image_description: Two students are working on a science experiment in a classroom.
questions.sample_answer: Two students are working together on a science experiment in a classroom.

questions.image_description: A group of people are planting trees in a park.
questions.sample_answer: A group of people are planting trees in a park to help the environment.

questions.image_description: A doctor is talking to a patient in a clinic.
questions.sample_answer: A doctor is speaking with a patient in a clinic. They seem to be discussing health problems.

questions.image_description: A young man is using a laptop in a cafe while drinking coffee.
questions.sample_answer: A young man is using a laptop in a cafe while drinking coffee.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think technology makes life better?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, I think technology makes life better because it helps us communicate faster and work more efficiently. It also gives us access to a lot of useful information.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think environmental protection should be taught in schools?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, environmental protection should be taught in schools. Students need to learn how to take care of the planet. This knowledge will help them make better decisions in the future.

questions.question_text_en: Should students do volunteer activities?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, students should do volunteer activities because they can learn responsibility and understand the needs of society. It also helps them grow as people.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think science will solve global health problems?
questions.sample_answer: I think science will help solve many global health problems by developing new medicines and technologies. However, people must also improve their lifestyles.

questions.question_text_en: Should schools use more digital tools in the classroom?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, digital tools can make learning more interesting and effective. Students can access many resources and study at their own pace.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think people should exercise more?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, people should exercise more because it helps them stay healthy and reduces stress. Regular exercise also improves mental health.

questions.question_text_en: What do you usually do to stay healthy?
questions.sample_answer: I try to exercise regularly and eat healthy food.

questions.question_text_en: How do you usually get information about the world?
questions.sample_answer: I usually get information from news websites and online videos.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think volunteering is important?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, it helps people understand social problems and support their communities.

questions.question_text_en: What environmental problems are common today?
questions.sample_answer: Climate change, air pollution, and plastic waste are major problems today.

questions.question_text_en: How can schools encourage students to read more?
questions.sample_answer: Schools can encourage students by giving them time to read and recommending interesting books.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think using technology in class is helpful?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, it helps students access information quickly and learn in different ways.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think governments should invest more in science research?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, because scientific research can solve important problems such as diseases and environmental issues. It also helps create new technologies.

questions.question_text_en: Should schools teach more about social issues?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, students should learn about social issues so they can understand the world better and think about how to solve problems in society.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think exercise should be part of everyone’s lifestyle?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, regular exercise helps people stay physically and mentally healthy. It also improves energy levels.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think students should study abroad? Write an essay explaining your opinion with two reasons.
Should cities create more green spaces such as parks?
Should schools use digital textbooks instead of paper ones?
Should people work from home more often?
Do you think science education should start earlier in school?
Should healthy eating be taught as a required school subject?
Should people rely more on public transportation?
Why does the writer enjoy using technology?
questions.passage: I enjoy using technology because it helps me learn new things quickly. I often use online videos and articles to study topics that are not taught in school.
choices: Because it helps them learn quickly
Because it helps them play games
questions.correct_answer: Because it helps them learn quickly

questions.question_text_en: What did the writer do at the volunteer event?
questions.passage: Last weekend, I joined a volunteer event to clean a river in my city. Many people worked together to collect trash and remove plants blocking the river.

questions.question_text_en: Why is the forest important to the town?
questions.passage: The forest near our town is an important place for animals and plants. It also provides clean air and a quiet area for people to relax.
choices: Because it is a tourist spot

questions.question_text_en: What did the writer learn?
questions.passage: I learned a lot from studying abroad. I met people from different backgrounds and learned how to communicate better in English.

questions.question_text_en: Why does the writer want to become a scientist?
questions.passage: I want to become a scientist because I am interested in discovering new medicines that can help sick people around the world.

questions.question_text_en: What is one problem mentioned in the passage?
questions.passage: Many cities are facing problems with air pollution. Cars and factories produce harmful gases, which make the air unhealthy.

questions.question_text_en: Where does the writer study most often?
questions.passage: I usually study at the school library because it is quiet. Sometimes I go to a cafe when I want a change of scenery.

questions.question_text_en: What does the writer do to stay healthy?
questions.passage: To stay healthy, I try to cook meals at home using fresh vegetables. I also take walks in the evening to relax.

questions.question_text_en: Students should learn how to think critically, ___ will help them in the future.
If people used public transportation more often, the air ___ cleaner.
The number of people who work from home ___ increasing.
Many scientists believe that new technologies will ___ the quality of life.
Some people think that students today do not read as ___ as they used to.
___ technology continues to develop, new jobs will appear.
Eating healthy food is one of the best ways to ___ diseases.
More people are becoming aware of environmental problems, ___ is a good sign.
Why do some people prefer online classes?
questions.passage: Some students prefer online classes because they can study at their own pace. They also save time by not having to travel to school.
choices: Because they can study at their own pace
Because they can meet many friends
questions.correct_answer: Because they can study at their own pace

questions.question_text_en: What does the writer think about electric cars?
questions.passage: Electric cars are becoming more popular. I think they are good for the environment because they do not produce harmful gases.
choices: They are good for the environment
questions.correct_answer: They are good for the environment

questions.question_text_en: Why does the writer enjoy learning science?
questions.passage: I enjoy learning science because it helps me understand how the world works. I also like doing experiments in class.
choices: Because it helps them understand the world
questions.correct_answer: Because it helps them understand the world

questions.question_text_en: Why did the writer start exercising?
questions.passage: I started exercising because I wanted to feel healthier. After exercising regularly, I found that I had more energy.

questions.question_text_en: What is one problem the town is facing?
questions.passage: Our town has a growing problem with traffic. More cars on the road mean longer travel times and more air pollution.

questions.question_text_en: Where does the writer like to relax?
questions.passage: I like to relax in quiet places such as the park near my house. The fresh air and greenery help me feel calm.

questions.question_text_en: Why does the writer think science is important for the future?
questions.passage: Science is important for the future because it helps solve global problems like diseases and environmental issues. It also leads to new inventions.

questions.question_text_en: Why does the writer enjoy using the library?
questions.passage: I enjoy using the library because it is quiet and has many books on different subjects. It is the best place for me to study.
choices: Because it is quiet and has many books
questions.correct_answer: Because it is quiet and has many books

questions.question_text_en: Please read the passage aloud and summarize it in your own words.
questions.passage: Many experts believe that climate change is becoming one of the most serious issues in the world. Rising temperatures are causing more extreme weather, such as heat waves, heavy rains, and strong storms. Scientists say that people must reduce carbon emissions if they want to slow down these changes.
questions.sample_answer: The passage says that climate change is becoming worse and causing extreme weather. Experts say people need to reduce carbon emissions.

questions.question_text_en: Please read the passage aloud and summarize it.
questions.passage: Artificial intelligence (AI) is rapidly changing many industries. It can analyze large amounts of data and perform tasks more accurately than humans. However, some people worry that AI may take jobs away from workers in the future.
questions.sample_answer: AI is improving many industries by analyzing data accurately, but some people worry it may replace workers.

questions.question_text_en: Summarize the passage.
questions.passage: Global health organizations are working to stop the spread of infectious diseases. They provide vaccines, educate people, and support medical workers in developing countries. Their efforts have saved millions of lives.
questions.sample_answer: Global health groups fight infectious diseases by giving vaccines, educating people, and supporting medical workers.

questions.question_text_en: Summarize the passage.
questions.passage: Many governments are starting programs to reduce plastic waste. They encourage people to recycle and use eco-friendly products. These programs aim to protect the environment and reduce pollution.
questions.sample_answer: Governments are trying to reduce plastic waste by promoting recycling and eco-friendly products.

questions.question_text_en: Summarize the passage.
questions.passage: Electric vehicles are becoming more popular because they do not produce exhaust gases. Many companies are developing new technologies to make batteries last longer and charge faster.
questions.sample_answer: Electric vehicles are growing in popularity because they reduce pollution, and companies are improving battery technology.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think schools should teach more about environmental issues?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, schools should teach more about environmental issues. Students need to understand how their actions affect the planet. Learning this early will help them make better choices as adults.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think governments should invest more in science research?
questions.sample_answer: I believe governments should invest more in science research because new discoveries can improve people’s lives. Research can lead to better medicine, cleaner energy, and solutions to global issues.

questions.question_text_en: Should people work remotely more often?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, remote work offers flexibility and reduces commuting time. It can also help the environment by lowering emissions. However, companies should support workers to avoid isolation.

questions.question_text_en: Is climate change the most serious problem in the world today?
questions.sample_answer: Climate change is one of the most serious problems because it affects weather, food production, and people’s safety. If we do not act now, the consequences will become much worse.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think technology will improve education in the future?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, technology will likely improve education by giving students access to more information and personalized learning tools. However, teachers will still play an important role.

questions.question_text_en: Should governments do more to support public health?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, governments should support public health by improving medical systems and providing education on healthy lifestyles. This will reduce diseases and healthcare costs.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think economic equality is important?
questions.sample_answer: I think economic equality is important because large income gaps create social problems. Governments should ensure everyone has access to basic services like education and healthcare.

questions.question_text_en: Should science classes focus more on experiments?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, experiments help students understand scientific ideas better. They also make learning more enjoyable and encourage curiosity.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think international cooperation is important?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, many problems such as climate change and disease cannot be solved by one country alone. Nations must work together to create effective solutions.

questions.question_text_en: Should schools teach students more about mental health?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, understanding mental health is essential for students. It helps them manage stress and recognize when they need help.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think the use of AI in daily life is good?
questions.sample_answer: AI can make life more convenient, but people must use it carefully. We need rules to protect privacy and prevent misuse.

questions.question_text_en: What global issues are you most concerned about?
questions.sample_answer: I'm concerned about climate change because it affects the entire planet.

questions.question_text_en: How do you think technology will change the workplace?
questions.sample_answer: Technology will automate some tasks but also create new kinds of jobs.

questions.question_text_en: What can people do to stay healthy?
questions.sample_answer: They can exercise regularly and eat balanced meals.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think countries should work together to solve environmental problems?
questions.sample_answer: Yes, because environmental issues affect all countries, so cooperation is necessary.

questions.question_text_en: Many scientists warn that climate change will continue ___ people take strong action.
Some experts believe that AI will create new jobs, ___ others worry it may increase unemployment.
Why does the writer believe international cooperation is necessary?
questions.passage: Many global issues today cannot be solved by a single country. Problems such as climate change, pandemics, and economic instability require countries to share information and work together. The writer believes that international cooperation helps nations respond more effectively to crises.
choices: Because many problems require countries to work together
Because countries want to compete more
Because individual countries can easily solve global problems
questions.correct_answer: Because many problems require countries to work together

questions.question_text_en: What does the writer suggest people should do to stay informed?
questions.passage: With so much information available online, it is important for people to check reliable sources. The writer recommends reading different viewpoints and avoiding articles that spread misinformation.

questions.question_text_en: Why does the writer support increasing funding for science?
questions.passage: Science plays a vital role in solving global challenges. From developing new medical treatments to improving clean energy technologies, scientific research benefits society in many ways. The writer argues that more funding will speed up progress.
choices: Because scientific research solves major global challenges
Because science is more important than education
questions.correct_answer: Because scientific research solves major global challenges

questions.question_text_en: What problem is mentioned in the passage?
questions.passage: Many cities are struggling with the rapid increase in population. This growth has led to overcrowded public transportation systems, housing shortages, and rising pollution.

questions.question_text_en: Why does the writer enjoy studying global politics?
questions.passage: I enjoy studying global politics because it helps me understand how different countries make decisions. It also teaches me how international organizations work to solve conflicts and promote peace.
choices: Because it explains how countries make decisions
questions.correct_answer: Because it explains how countries make decisions

questions.question_text_en: What does the writer say is important for good health?
questions.passage: Good health does not come from medical care alone. People need access to clean water, healthy food, and safe living conditions. The writer believes that improving living environments will greatly reduce health problems.

questions.question_text_en: Summarize the following passage.
questions.passage: Many experts argue that countries need to work together to fight global warming. They say that no single nation can reduce emissions enough on its own. International cooperation is necessary to create effective long-term solutions.
questions.sample_answer: Experts say countries must work together to fight global warming because one nation cannot reduce emissions alone.

questions.question_text_en: Summarize the following passage.
questions.passage: Advances in medical technology have allowed doctors to diagnose diseases earlier than ever before. Early diagnosis often leads to more effective treatment and better patient outcomes.
questions.sample_answer: Medical technology helps doctors diagnose diseases early, which leads to more effective treatment.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think technology will replace many jobs in the future?
Should governments invest more in renewable energy?
Is globalization a positive force in today's world?
The scientist suggested that more research ___ before any conclusions were made.
It is important for citizens to stay informed, ___ they can make responsible decisions.
What is one reason the writer supports scientific transparency?
questions.passage: Scientific transparency allows researchers from different countries to share information and verify results. This helps prevent misinformation and ensures that scientific progress is trustworthy. The writer argues that open communication in science is essential for solving global problems.
choices: It reduces the cost of research

questions.question_text_en: Do you think international cooperation is essential for solving global crises?
questions.sample_answer: Yes. International cooperation is essential because global crises such as climate change, pandemics, and economic instability cannot be solved by individual countries. Shared expertise and joint policymaking lead to more effective solutions.

questions.question_text_en: Should governments regulate the development of artificial intelligence more strictly?
questions.sample_answer: Yes. AI has the potential to improve society, but without proper regulation, it may harm privacy, employment, and security. Governments should create clear guidelines to ensure safe and ethical development.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think globalization benefits developing countries?
questions.sample_answer: Globalization can benefit developing countries by providing access to international markets and technology. However, governments must manage risks such as economic inequality and dependence on foreign companies.

questions.question_text_en: Should wealthy nations take more responsibility for addressing climate change?
questions.sample_answer: Yes. Wealthy nations have contributed most to historical emissions and have the resources to take action. They should lead efforts such as investing in renewable energy and supporting developing countries.

questions.question_text_en: Is scientific literacy essential for citizens in modern society?
questions.sample_answer: Yes. Scientific literacy helps people evaluate information, understand public policies, and make responsible decisions. It is crucial in areas such as health, technology, and environmental protection.

questions.question_text_en: Should governments invest more in public health systems?
questions.sample_answer: Yes. Strong public health systems save lives and reduce long-term medical costs. Investment in prevention, education, and accessibility is essential for national security and social stability.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think democratic nations should promote democracy abroad?
questions.sample_answer: Democratic nations may support democracy abroad, but they must respect cultural and political contexts. Forced intervention often fails, while education and cooperation are more effective.

questions.question_text_en: Should countries rely more on renewable energy sources?
questions.sample_answer: Yes. Renewable energy reduces pollution and dependence on fossil fuels. Although initial costs are high, long-term environmental and economic benefits are significant.

questions.question_text_en: What global issue worries you the most?
questions.sample_answer: Climate change worries me most because it affects every region and threatens future generations.

questions.question_text_en: How can societies prepare for future pandemics?
questions.sample_answer: Societies can prepare by strengthening health systems, improving communication, and investing in scientific research.

questions.question_text_en: Do you think economic inequality will increase in the future?
questions.sample_answer: It may increase unless governments address wage gaps, education inequality, and access to technology.

questions.question_text_en: What role should technology play in education?
questions.sample_answer: Technology should support learning by providing access to resources, but it should not replace human interaction.

questions.question_text_en: What can individuals do to reduce their environmental impact?
questions.sample_answer: They can reduce energy use, recycle more, and support environmentally responsible companies.

questions.question_text_en: Should governments regulate social media platforms more strictly?
Is space exploration worth the cost?
Should nations prioritize economic growth over environmental protection?
Should voting be mandatory in democratic countries?
Do you think technological progress will always improve human life?
Why does the writer believe scientific cooperation is essential?
questions.passage: Scientific challenges such as developing vaccines and understanding climate systems require global knowledge. The writer argues that when countries share information openly, research becomes faster and more reliable.
choices: Because it speeds up reliable research
Because it is required by law
questions.correct_answer: Because it speeds up reliable research

questions.question_text_en: What is the main problem described?
questions.passage: Many large cities are experiencing rising housing costs. This makes it difficult for young people and low-income families to find affordable places to live, contributing to economic inequality.

questions.question_text_en: What solution does the writer suggest for reducing political polarization?
questions.passage: Political polarization has become a major issue in many democracies. The writer argues that one effective solution is improving education on media literacy. By teaching people how to evaluate information critically, society can reduce the influence of misinformation and extreme opinions.

questions.question_text_en: What is the writer’s main concern?
questions.passage: As technology advances rapidly, many people worry about the future of privacy. Companies collect vast amounts of data, often without users fully understanding how it will be used. The writer warns that stronger regulations are necessary to protect citizens.

questions.question_text_en: Why does the writer support cultural exchange programs?
questions.passage: Cultural exchange programs allow students to experience different lifestyles and learn new perspectives. The writer believes these programs help reduce prejudice and promote international understanding.

questions.question_text_en: Many experts argue that economic growth must be balanced with environmental protection, ___ long-term sustainability cannot be achieved.
The government is considering policies to support workers who may lose their jobs as automation becomes ___ common.
It is vital that the public ___ access to reliable information during emergencies.
The report proposes several measures, one of ___ is improving transparency in political funding.
Should developed countries take stronger measures to prevent global pandemics?
Do you believe economic sanctions are an effective foreign policy tool?
Should governments support the development of artificial intelligence even if it risks job loss?
Is economic inequality the most serious social issue today?
Should schools focus more on teaching critical thinking than memorization?
Why does the writer say renewable energy investment is necessary?
questions.passage: Experts argue that renewable energy is vital not only for reducing greenhouse gases but also for ensuring energy independence. Countries that rely heavily on imported fossil fuels face economic instability. Investing in renewable energy can help prevent future crises.
choices: It reduces emissions and increases energy independence
It is cheaper than all fossil fuels
It removes the need for technology
questions.correct_answer: It reduces emissions and increases energy independence

questions.question_text_en: What is the writer’s main point?
questions.passage: Some believe automation will completely eliminate certain industries, while others argue it will create new opportunities. The writer suggests that the future depends on how governments and businesses manage technological changes.
choices: The impact of automation depends on policies
questions.correct_answer: The impact of automation depends on policies

questions.question_text_en: Why does the writer criticize current political systems?
questions.passage: The writer argues that many political systems fail to address long-term issues such as climate change and economic inequality. Politicians tend to focus on short-term gains to win elections rather than sustainable policies.
choices: They spend too much on education

questions.question_text_en: What is one major benefit of scientific collaboration?
questions.passage: When scientists from different countries collaborate, they share knowledge, equipment, and perspectives. This not only accelerates discoveries but also reduces the likelihood of errors.

questions.question_text_en: What does the writer suggest as a way to improve global health?
questions.passage: Improving global health requires not only better hospitals but also stronger public infrastructure. Clean water systems, reliable electricity, and safe housing all play critical roles in preventing disease.

questions.question_text_en: Why is misinformation considered dangerous?
questions.passage: Misinformation spreads quickly online and can influence public opinion. It may lead people to make harmful decisions, especially during crises such as pandemics or elections.

questions.question_text_en: Why does the writer emphasize long-term environmental planning?
questions.passage: Short-term environmental policies may provide quick benefits but often fail to address deeper issues. Long-term planning helps ensure sustainable resource use and prevents future disasters.

questions.question_text_en: What is the writer’s main argument?
questions.passage: Economic stability depends heavily on education. When citizens have access to high-quality learning opportunities, societies innovate more and adapt quickly to global changes.
